techmeme.title: Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai says the US search and ads antitrust lawsuits are "going to take time ... to play out" and an appeal "will likely take many years" (Alicia Clanton/Bloomberg)
Whatfix, which helps companies demo how to use third-party software, raised a $125M Series E led by Warburg Pincus at an estimated ~$900M valuation (Kyle Wiggers/TechCrunch)
Google files an EU antitrust complaint against Microsoft, alleging it engages in unfair cloud practices and is "exploiting" its customers' reliance on Windows (Javier Espinoza/Financial Times)
Book excerpt: how Activision CEO Bobby Kotick and Blizzard co-founder Mike Morhaime, once the industry's unstoppable pair, had a falling out starting in 2013 (Jason Schreier/Bloomberg)
Reddit begins rolling out its ML-powered translations in Brazil, Spain, Germany, Italy, the Philippines, and 30+ others on the web, mobile, and desktop (Paul Sawers/TechCrunch)
